title: Army intelligence leads to major drug and wallapatta seizures
byline: Swift action based on intelligence received by the Army Intelligence Unit led to the arrest of several suspects involved in illegal drug trafficking and the possession of wallapatta (Gyrinops walla) during two separate joint operations conducted, the Army said.

title: Couple filming nude content for UK website arrested in Rajagiriya
byline: A married couple who had uploaded nude videos of themselves to a subscription-based adult website in UK have been arrested by officers of the Nugegoda Divisional Children and Women’s Bureau.

title: More than 1,400 flights cancelled as US air traffic cuts enter second day
byline: More than 1,400 flights to, from, or within the US were cancelled on Saturday after airlines were told this week to cut traffic during the federal government shutdown.

title: Macroeconomic stability a result of continuity with IMF  programme- Ali Sabry
byline: Making his remarks on the budget , former Foreign Affairs Minister Ali Sabry said that the current macroeconomic stability is only a result of continuity with the IMF programme and the government should be congratulated for keeping intact .

title: National Program distributes 500,000 coconut plants
byline: A national program to distribute 500,000 coconut plants for homestead cultivation was launched this morning (09) in Uhana, Ampara, with the aim of reducing poverty and promoting coconut cultivation across the country.

title: Cardinal blasts sex education move backed by foreign agencies
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith has raised serious concern over what he described as an “inappropriate sexual education program” proposed for inclusion in Sri Lanka’s school curriculum next year.

title: Annual information updates begin for ‘Aswesuma’ beneficiaries
byline: The annual information update process for recipients of the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit scheme is now underway.

title: Sri Lankan expertise strengthens ties with Dr. Sulaiman Al Habib Medical Group
byline: Sri Lankan professionals are making a notable impact on the regional healthcare industry through their contributions to the Dr. Sulaiman Al Habib Medical Services Group’s development centre in Colombo, a collaboration that is now paving the way for deeper investment and partnership opportunities.

title: Syria’s Sharaa arrives in US for Trump talks after sanctions lifted
byline: Syrian President Ahmed Sharaa has arrived in Washington for an official visit, just two days after the US formally revoked his status as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist.

title: Plantation workers pledge support to President following wage increase
byline: Following the government’s decision to raise the daily wage of plantation workers to Rs. 1,750 under the 2026 Budget, workers in the Agarapathana area prepared and shared milk rice on Saturday (09) to express their gratitude to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Philippines evacuates 100,000 people as Fung-wong intensifies into super typhoon
byline: The Philippines evacuated over 100,000 residents across its eastern and northern regions as Fung-wong intensified on Sunday into a super typhoon ahead of its expected arrival later in the day, threatening to unleash torrential rains, destructive winds, and storm surges.

title: More than 1,400 flights cancelled as US air traffic cuts enter second day
byline: More than 1,400 flights to, from, or within the US were cancelled on Saturday after airlines were told this week to cut traffic during the federal government shutdown.

title: Imports outpace exports, FLSP challenges President’s forex stability claim
byline: Sri Lanka’s imports have grown in excess of its export earnings, widening the balance of payments deficit  ,and therefore, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s claim of stability in foreign exchange flows holds no water, Frontline Socialist Party (FLSP) Education Secretary Pubudu Jayagoda said.

title: Seven Sri Lankan drug suspects abroad to surrender: Minister
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said that seven Sri Lankan drug traffickers who are currently hiding in Middle Eastern countries have conveyed their willingness to surrender to local authorities.

title: Tsunami warning issued after 6.8 earthquake strikes off Japan’s eastern coast
byline: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.8 struck off Japan’s eastern coast at 0803GMT on Sunday, the US Geological Survey said.

title: Migrant vessel sinks off Malaysia-Thailand border, hundreds missing
byline: Hundreds were missing on Sunday after a boat sank near the Thailand-Malaysia border, as 10 survivors and one body were recovered, the Malaysian maritime authority said.

title: Budget neglect may drive young doctors abroad: Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa
byline: The government’s failure to address salary discrepancies and welfare issues of doctors could accelerate the migration of young medical professionals, Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa, Chairman of the Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance warns.

title: Child drowns in hotel swimming pool in Sigiriya
byline: A five-year-old child has died after drowning in a swimming pool at a hotel in the Audangawa area in Sigiriya.

title: Rugby Bosses Blow Up League in Foul Start
byline: In a lightning move the newly elected administration of Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR) has gone against tradition and possible fair play and converted the Premier League, giving it a knockout blow that has agitated the country’s most soughtafter entity, Kandy Sports Club.

title: Fossil resembling 3-horned dinosaur, Triceratops, found in UP’s Saharanpur
byline: A fossil believed to be of a Triceratops, the three-horned dinosaur, has been excavated along the banks of the Sahansara River in the Saharanpur district of Uttar Pradesh, according to a researcher.

title: Tsunami warning issued after 6.8 earthquake strikes off Japan’s eastern coast
byline: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.8 struck off Japan’s eastern coast at 0803GMT on Sunday, the US Geological Survey said.

title: Migrant vessel sinks off Malaysia-Thailand border, hundreds missing
byline: Hundreds were missing on Sunday after a boat sank near the Thailand-Malaysia border, as 10 survivors and one body were recovered, the Malaysian maritime authority said.
